With an Intelligence of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds} you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of Reaper spells requires time spent in study and review: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Reaper spells. The power of your spells comes from your thorough research and preparation into aetherology. You use your Intelligence whenever a Reaper spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Reaper spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a Reaper spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use your momento from the voidsent as a spell casting focus for your Reaper spells.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Reaper Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you choose your focus as a Reaper: Death's Blade, Grim Keeper or Doomsinger. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Reaper Archetype.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Reaper Archetype.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Reaper Archetype.

classFeature.name: Veil of Shadows
entries: Also, beginning at 3rd level, while your voidsent is active you may use your bonus action to act as a host for your void avatar. The Void Avatar becomes one with you, cloaking you in its dark magic. When you do so, you may spend a number of hit die up to your proficiency bonus and gain temporary hit points equal to the result.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Sixth Sense
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you may cast the {@spell See Invisibility} or {@spell Speak with Dead} spell without expending a spell slot once per day.

classFeature.name: Reaper Art: Reaping Rondo
entries: Beginning at 9th level, as an action, you unleash a large sweeping attack imbued in necrotic energy. All creatures in a 10ft. centered on you make a Dexterity saving throw against your Reaper spell save DC, taking damage equal to your weapon damage + {@dice 1d12} necrotic on a failure, and half as much on a success.
If you are hosting your {@creature void avatar|FFXIVBeforetheFall}, this attack deals bonus necrotic damage equal to your wisdom modifier.

classFeature.name: Reaper Art: Memento Mori
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one Reaper spell slot to empower your swing, filling your target with dark energies. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw against your Reaper spell save DC. On a failure a creature takes {@dice 3d8} necrotic damage and becomes {@condition frightened}. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition frightened}. This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell above 1st.

A {@condition frightened} creature has disadvantage on Ability Checks and Attack Rolls while the source of its fear is within Line of Sight and the creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.

classFeature.name: Shadow Walk
entries: Beginning at 13th level, while you are hosting the {@creature Void Avatar|FFXIVBeforetheFall}, as a bonus action you can become incorporeal until the end of your turn. You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.
You take 5 ({@dice 1d10}) force damage and are ejected to the nearest unoccupied space if you end your turn inside an object.
You may do so a number of times equal to your Wisdom ability modifier. Uses of this feature are recovered when you complete a long rest.

classFeature.name: Void Gaze
entries: Beginning at 14th level, when you are hosting the Void Avatar, you gain 30ft. of {@sense truesight}.

classFeature.name: Dark Martyr
entries: Beginning at 17th level, when you are reduced to 0 hit points and not outright killed, as a reaction, you may dismiss your void avatar to recover {@dice 4d8} + your Wisdom modifier hit points before falling {@condition prone}. You may not summon your void avatar again until you complete a long rest.

classFeature.name: Gate of Tartarus
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, you may cast the {@spell plane shift} spell without requiring the material components. You may not use the spell to banish an unwilling an unwilling creature. You may cast {@spell plane shift} in this way once without experiencing detrimental effects, additional uses of the spell before completing a long rest cause a level of {@condition exhaustion} to all creatures affected.

classFeature.name: Vessel of Death
entries: Starting at 20th level, you always have the benefit of hosting the void avatar.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As an aspiring mage, you can cast sage spells, See the spell list included at the end of this document for the {@filter sage spell list|spells|class=Sage (FFXIV5E)}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three {@filter cantrips of your choice from the sage spell list|spells|class=Sage (FFXIV5E)|level=0} . You learn additional sage cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Sage table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Sage table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expand a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of sage spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the sage spell list. When you do so, choose a number of sage spells equal to your Intelligence modifier + your Sage level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level sage, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds} you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of sage spells requires time spent in study and review: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your sage spells. The power of your spells comes from your thorough research and preparation into aetherology. You use your Intelligence whenever a sage spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a sage spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a sage spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use your Nouliths as a spellcasting focus for your sage spells.

classFeature.name: Nouliths
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you have achieved mastery over operating your first Noulith. These devices which combine magic and technology feed off the aether of your body to act and can be used to create a variety of different effects. At 5th level, you learn to operate a second Noulith simultaneously. At 10th level, you gain the ability to control a third Noulith, a fourth at the 15th level and a fifth at 20th level. When additional Nouliths become available to you, you are able to build them at no cost.

Nouliths have are tiny constructs with an AC of 15, Hit Points equal to 15 + 5 time your Sage level, and a flying speed of 30ft. Creatures may exist in the same space as your nouliths, and are not blocked by them. Your nouliths must remain within a 60ft. radius of you, losing their aetheric link with you if they travel any further away. If this occurs, they become inoperable and fall to the ground. As an action, you may reactivate them by touching them and re-establishing their aetheric link with your body.

If a Noulith is reduced to 0 hit points, it becomes in operable and falls to the ground. It may be repaired during a long rest at the cost of 10 gold in materials. You are able to restore your Nouliths hit points at no cost during a long rest as long as it is still operable. If they are totally destroyed, you must spend 100 gold and one day of time to rebuild.
As a bonus action you may maneuver your Nouliths, moving them a distance up to their flying speed.

classFeature.name: Aether Shot
entries: Also beginning at 1st level, you have learned how to use the aether fueling your Nouliths offensively. As an action, you order your Noulith to make a ranged spell attack, using your ranged spell attack bonus, on a creature within 30ft. of them. On hit, the Aether Shot deals {@dice 1d8} force damage.

If you are operating more than one Noulith, each Noulith may make a ranged spell attack. Each Noulith may target a different creature. If a Noulith is equipped to someone they may still be used with Aether Shot.

classFeature.name: Sagely Specialization
entries: At 2nd level, you choose your focus as a sage, pushing the limits of your Nouliths in new and exciting directions. As a Savant, you choose to continue to augment your Nouliths for combat. As an Erudite, you have chosen to develop the defensive capabilities of the Nouliths, and as a Philosopher, you've focused on integrating your own spell casting with your Nouliths.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sagely Specialization feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Sagely Specialization.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sagely Specialization feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Sagely Specialization.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sagely Specialization feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Sagely Specialization.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Wings of Aether
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, if a Noulith is not deployed, it is considered equipped to you, granting you a flying speed. For each Noulith equipped to you, you gain a flying speed of 10ft.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Noulithic God
entries: Starting at 20th level, you have mastered combat with Nouliths. As a bonus action you refresh your Overcharge feature. You can do this once. You must complete a long rest before you can use Noulithic God again.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the PHB for the general rules of spellcasting and the end of this document for the {@filter White Mage spell list|spells|class=White Mage (FFXIV5E)}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know 3 cantrips of your choice from the White Mage spell list. You learn additional White Mage cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the White Mage table.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: The White Mage table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of white mage spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the white mage spell list. When you do so, choose a number of white mage spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your white mage level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level white mage, you have four 1st-levei and two 2nd-levei spell slots. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of white mage spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your White Mage spells. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a White Mage spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a rod, cane, wand or other similar equipment as an arcane focus (found in {@book chapter 5|PHB|5} of the Player's Handbook) for your White Mage spells.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast any White Mage spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

classFeature.name: Confession
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you gain the bonus action Prayer. When you use Prayer you gain a charge of Confession. When you use prayer while you already have a charge of confession, you double the number of charges you currently have, then gain 1 charge.
You may hold a number of confession charges equal to your proficiency bonus. You must be in combat to use prayer, your confession charges fade away after spending 1 minute outside of combat.

classFeature.name: Reach of the Unseen
entries: Also beginning at 1st level, when you cast a spell, you may spend 1 charge of confession to commission the elementals of the world to carry your spell. If your spell is a touch spell, you may cast it as a ranged spell up to a distance of 30ft.

classFeature.name: Conjury Discipline
entries: At 2nd level, you choose the discipline you belong to as a White Mage. Elementalist, Spirit Master, or Ampdapori, all detailed at the end of the class description. Your archetype choice grants you features at the 1st, 6th, 10th and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Afflatus Solace
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, as an action you may spend any number of your confession charges. You heal a creature within 30ft. of you for #d4 + your proficiency bonus, where # is equal to the charges of confession spent.
Your Prayer bonus action cannot have been used before or after using Afflatus Solace on your turn. The target creature must have more than 0 hit points.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Conjury Discipline Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Conjury Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Conjury Discipline Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Conjury Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Conjury Discipline Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Conjury Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Conservation of Life
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, when your hit points are reduced to 0 and you fall unconscious, you release a pulse of healing energy. All allies, excluding yourself, within a 30ft. radius are healed for {@dice 2d8} + your Wisdom ability modifier hit points. This is unaffected by Touch of the Padjal. This effect only occurs once. You must then finish a long rest to use Conservation of Life again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Graceful Healer
entries: Beginning at the 20th level, you gain two Confession charges when you roll for initiative at the beginning of battle.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Beginning at the 1st level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty, Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Berserk
entries: Beginning at the 1st level, on your turn, you can enter a Berserk state of mind, letting your inner beast act freely. While under the effect of Berserk you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.
When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a bonus to the damage roll that increases as you gain levels as a Warrior, as shown in the Berserk Damage Column of the Warrior table.
When you take slashing, piercing or bludgeoning damage, you reduce the damage by half your Constitution modifier rounded up.

entries: If you are able to cast spells, you are unable to do so while berserking due to an inability to concentrate.
Some warrior class features require target creatures to make saving throws. This is contested by your Berserk DC, calculated below.

Your berserk state lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you have not attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your berserk state on your turn as a bonus action. For a number of rounds equal to 5 minus your Constitution modifier after your berserk state ends, you may not use the Extra Attack ability and your base movement speed is halved due to fatigue.
Once you have gone berserk the number of times shown in for your warrior level in the Berserks column of the Warrior table, you must finish a long rest before you can go Berserk again.

classFeature.name: Reckless Attack
entries: Starting at 2nd level, when you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during that turn, but attack rolls against you are rolled with advantage until the beginning of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Beastly Demeanor
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level you gain a passive {@skill Intimidation} score which you may use to replace rolls when making {@skill Intimidation} ability checks. This passive {@skill Intimidation} score is equal to 10 + your Strength modifier.

classFeature.name: Warrior Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you select the tradition under which your warrior has trained. The Beast of Defiance tradition focus on restraining the inner beast of the warrior, and letting its power out only when needed.

The Beast of Deliverance tradition focuses on allowing the inner beast to run wild, fighting alongside its power to lay your enemies low. The Marauder has turned from harnessing their inner beast to become fierce fighters on their own power.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Warrior Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Warrior Archetype feature.

classFeature.name: Bellow of the Beast
entries: Beginning at the 7th level, you are able to attempt to dominate a conversation with the assistance of your inner beast. You may expend one use of Berserk to intimidate a creature with advantage and doubling all of your bonuses to the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

classFeature.name: Raw Intuition
entries: Also beginning at 7th level, when you are struck by a melee weapon attack, as a reaction you may move directly back 5ft. from the creature and reduce the damage you have taken by {@dice 1d6}. This damage reduction is increased to {@dice 2d6} at the 13th level and {@dice 3d6} at the 18th level. You can do this once. You must then finish a long rest to use Raw Intuition again.
You can use this feature twice between long rests starting at 13th level and three times between long rests starting at 18th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Onslaught
entries: Beginning at the 9th level, when you use the {@action Dash} action, you may make a melee weapon attack as a bonus action. You deal bonus damage on the attack equal to your Constitution modifier.

classFeature.name: Warrior Archetype Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Warrior Archetype feature.

classFeature.name: Revenge
entries: Beginning at the 11th level, when a creature resolves an melee weapon attack action against you, as a reaction you may make one weapon attack against that creature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Shake it Off
entries: Beginning at the 13th level, while under the effects of Berserk, when you make a saving throw to resist a condition (excluding: {@condition exhaustion}, {@condition grappled}, {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, {@condition stunned} and {@condition unconscious}) you may choose to end your Berserk state to automatically succeed on the saving throw. You may do this after your roll but before the outcome of the resist has been declared.

classFeature.name: Warrior Archetype Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Warrior Archetype feature.

classFeature.name: Upheaval
entries: Beginning at the 15th level, while you are under the effects of Berserk, you are able to unleash a powerful blow fueled by your vigor. You make an unarmed strike, if you hit, you may declare you are using Upheaval. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failure your unarmed strike deals xd12 force damage, where x is equal to your Constitution modifier with a minimum of {@dice 1d12} force damage and half as much damage on a success. Your Berserk state immediately ends after delivering the blow.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Beastly Reflexes
entries: Beginning at the 17th level, while you are under the effects of Berserk you are able to make two reactions per round.

classFeature.name: Holmgang
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, while under the effects of Berserk, as a bonus action you are able to enter an indomitable state known as Holmgang. For a number of rounds equal to half your Constitution modifier, rounded down, your hit points can not fall below 1. Additionally, you may attempt to link yourself to a creature within 10ft. of you. If the creature is Large sized or smaller the target creature must make a Strength saving throw against your Berserk DC or be dragged to a space within 5 ft. of you. The creature cannot leave the 5ft. radius around you and your movement speed becomes 0ft. for the duration of Holmgang. You may only do this once. You must then finish a long rest to use Holmgang again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Infuriate
entries: Beginning at the 20th level, if you have no uses of Berserk left when you roll for initiative, you recover 2 uses of Berserk instantly.

classFeature.name: Artful Combat
entries: Beginning at 1st level, when wielding a versatile weapon with two hands, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: Also beginning at 1st level, While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Strength modifier + your Wisdom modifier. You can not use a shield and still gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Sen
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, you have learned to gather Sen charges inside your body. You may spend these charges to use a variety of samurai features. Some samurai features require other creatures to make a saving throw, which is contested by your Sword Art DC as calculated below.

You gain the bonus action {@i Focus}. When you use focus, you gain 1 charge of Sen. If you are currently holding a charge of Sen, you double the number of Sen charges you currently have and then gain 1 Sen charge.
You can store a maximum number of Sen charges equal to your proficiency bonus. Your Sen charges fade after spending 1 minute outside of combat.

classFeature.name: Higanbana
entries: Also beginning at the 2nd level, you have learned to perform the sword art Higanbana. As an action, you spend one Sen charge to use Higanbana. You make a melee weapon attack against a creature, if you hit, the target creature makes a Constitution saving throw against your Sword Art DC.

On a failure, the creature is grieviously wounded by your attack and at the start of each of their turns for the next minute, they take {@dice 1d4} slashing damage. As an action they may attempt to stop the bleeding by attempting the Constitution saving throw again.
At 5th level, when you use the Attack action with the Extra Attack feature, you may spend one Sen charge to replace the second attack with Higanbana.

classFeature.name: Code of Honor
entries: At 2nd level, when performing Charisma ability checks on intelligent creatures which you know have an organized martial background, you have advantage on the check.

classFeature.name: Samurai Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you select a way of the blade. The Iaijutsu focuses on delivering incredibly powerful attacks, the Blademaster, who lures and traps his opponents in counterattacks and the Ronin, who drifts about the battlefield, dancing through the fray.

classFeature.name: Third Eye
entries: Also beginning at 3rd level, as a bonus action you may spend a number of Sen to enter a state of fierce focus. For the next minute, your weapon damage rolls gain a bonus equal to the number of Sen charges expended to activate Third Eye.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Samurai Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Samurai Archetype.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon's lightning breath or a {@spell fireball} spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Studied Disciple
entries: At 9th level, you have balanced your might with your mind. You may learn any two skills which fall under Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

classFeature.name: Samurai Archetype Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Samurai Archetype.

classFeature.name: Hissatsu: Kyuten
entries: At 11th level, as an action you may spend 1 Sen charge to perform a wide sweeping attack around yourself. Each creature within 5ft. of you makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take damage equal to your weapon damage + your Wisdom modifier, and half as much on a success.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Whispers of the Kami
entries: At 13th level, you have learned to attune yourself to the world around you and listen to the spirits which surround you. Select two of the following spells: {@spell augury}, {@spell detect evil and good}, {@spell speak with dead}, or {@spell speak with plants}. You may cast either spell once before requiring a long rest.

classFeature.name: Samurai Archetype Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Samurai Archetype.

classFeature.name: Effective Meditation
entries: At 15th level, if you spend hit die during a short rest, the next time you roll initiative you gain 1 Sen charge.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Artisan of Combat
entries: Starting at 17th level, while wielding a versatile weapon with two hands, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

classFeature.name: Midare Setsugekka
entries: At 18th level, as an action, you may spend any number of Sen you have saved to a maximum number equal to your Wisdom modifier. You may make a melee weapon attack for each Sen charge you spent. You may not have moved prior to using this feature and may not move afterwards.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Meikyo Shisui
entries: At 20th level, as a bonus action you turn your body into a conductor for Sen energy. You gain Sen charges equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You may only do this once. You must finish a long rest to use Meikyo Shisui again.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the PHB for the general rules of spellcasting and the end of this document for the {@filter Red Mage spell list|spells|class=Red Mage (FFXIVBeforetheFall)}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know 4 cantrips of your choice from the Red Mage spell list. You learn additional Red Mage cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Red Mage table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Red Mage table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know 2 1st-level spells of your choice from the Red Mage spell list. The Spells Known column of the Red Mage table shows when you learn more Red Mage spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st, 2nd or 3rd level. Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Red Mage spells you know and replace it with another spell from the Red Mage spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Red Mage spells. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Red Mage spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a magically conductive stone inlaid in a decorative mount other similar equipment as an {@item arcane focus|PHB} for your Red Mage spells.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast any Red mage spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

classFeature.name: Flair Points
entries: At 1st level, you have a number of points for your Red Mage level in the Flair Points column of the Red Mage table. You regain all expended flair points when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Dual Cast
entries: At 1st level, when you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 1 flair point to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting. You may not do so with a spell greater than 4th level.

entries.name: Bonus Action Casting
entries: A spell cast with a bonus action is especially swift. You must use a bonus action on your turn to cast the spell, provided that you haven't already taken a bonus action this turn. You can't cast another spell during the same turn, except for a cantrip with a casting time of 1 action. {@book (PHB 202)|PHB|10|Casting Time|1}.

classFeature.name: Red Mage Style
entries: At 2nd level, you choose a style as a Red Mage. Sword Dancer, Spell Slinger or Battle Rose, all detailed at the end of the class description. Your archetype choice grants you features at the 2nd, 6th, 10th and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Red Mage Style Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Combat Style.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Red Mage Style Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Combat Style.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Red Mage Style Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Combat Style.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Battle Flourish
entries: At 18th level, when you roll initiative, you recover {@dice 1d4} flair points.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Acceleration
entries: At the 20th level, you may cast two spells using Dual Cast, rather than one spell and one cantrip. You must then finish a long rest to use Acceleration again.

classFeature.name: Suppressive Fire
entries: Beginning at level 1, when you use {@action Ready} action to prepare to attack a target creature, you are able to disable your target temporarily. If your attack hits, the target grature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Machinist save DC. On a failed save the creature is knocked {@condition prone} and their speed becomes 0ft. until the end of their turn.

classFeature.name: Technical Support
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, you are able to use your {@item artisan's tools|PHB} to disarm mechanical traps.

classFeature.name: Sounding Sentry
entries: Also at the 2nd level, you have developed a tiny device which casts the {@spell alarm} spell. You can affix it to a door or window, or have it monitor an area around itself in a 20ft. cube. You may use the device once before needing to charge it during a long rest.

classFeature.name: Machinist Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you choose which area of inventing you wish to pursue. You choose the Marksman, Tinkerer or Grenadier archetype.

classFeature.name: Technologist
entries: Also at 3rd level, you may have developed technologies alongside your Machinist archetype. Certain actions may require creatures to make saving throws or you to make attack rolls to hit. These are calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Reload
entries: Beginning at the 5th level, ranged weapons you use lose their loading property.

classFeature.name: Machinist Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Machinist Archetype.

classFeature.name: Peloton
entries: Beginning at the 6th level, your mental stamina allows you to push your body further. Your base movement increases by 5ft. and you may use your Intelligence modifier for Initiative rolls.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Eye For Design
entries: Beginning at the 9th level, when assessing mechanical systems and intentional designs, you gain advantage on {@skill Investigation} checks to understand how a mechanical system works and advantage on {@skill Survival} checks to track a creature within a building, village, town or city.

classFeature.name: Graze
entries: Beginning at the 10th level, you are able to target your ranged attacks to cause negative effects on your target. Using your bonus action, you can empower your next shot to target a limb causing different effects. If your attack lands, your target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Machinist save DC or fall under the selected effect. This effect lasts until your next action where applicable.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Machinist Archetype Feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Machinist Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Combat Roll
entries: Beginning at the 13th level, during battle you are able to perform a combat role. When you are targeted by an attack, you may use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack and move 5ft. to an open space without provoking an attack of opportunity. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ricochet
entries: Beginning at the 14th level, you may spend your reaction to perform a ricochet shot if you are attacking with a firearm. Upon landing a successful attack, you make a second attack against a creature within 5ft. of the first targeted creature. This second attack does not consume ammunition.

classFeature.name: Emergency Rescue
entries: Beginning at the 15th level, you have developed a life saving device which casts {@spell cure wounds} on creatures with 0 hit points on contact. Intelligence is your spell casting ability for this device.

As an action you can throw the palm sized spherical device at a creature within 20ft. of you. If you have 0 hit points at the start of your turn and the device in your possession, it will automatically activate and heal you as a free action.
The device can cast {@spell cure wounds} once. The device is recharged when you finish a short rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Machinist Archetype Feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Machinist Archetype.

classFeature.name: Cloaking Device
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, you've developed a cane sized device which turns you and all creatures within a 5ft. radius of you {@condition invisible} for 1 minute. All creatures must remain within 5ft. of the device to retain invisibility. You can use the cane once before you need to recharge it during a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Midas Touch
entries: Beginning at the 20th level, as a bonus action you can complete maintenance on an invention in an instant. You must then finish a long rest to use Midas Touch again.

entries.name: Firearms and Creations
entries: The cost of firearms and to rebuild lost, destroyed or stolen accessory equipment granted by features can be found in the {@table Machinist Equipment|FFXIVBeforetheFall|Machinist Appendix D on page 106}.

classFeature.name: Arms Smith
entries: Beginning at the 1st level, you have learned how to modify weaponry to incorporate a gunfire into their function. You spend 1 day of time working on your weapon to complete the conversion process.

entries.name: Gun Weapons
entries: Arms Smith is used to convert a weapon into a gun weapon such that it works with your abilities. The most common and obvious is to use a longsword or greatsword for this sort of thing but if your DM approves, you could turn any kind of weapon into a gunweapon. Magic weapons may also require extra time to convert or assistance to complete the modifications at your DM's discretion.
All weapons that have undergone this process will be referred to as Gunblades in this document.

classFeature.name: Munitions
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you've learned how to create cells which draw in magical energy from your body to charge themselves called Munitions. You have a number of munition charges your body can support, indicated on the class table above. You load up to 6 Munitions charges into your gunblade at a time. When you use Munition charges on attack rolls you expend a loaded charge. You may load more charges as an action.
When using abilities triggered through using your Munitions that require the enemy to make a saving throw, the saving throw is calculated as follows.
When using features which require you to make a ranged attack, your modifier is calculated as follows:
Half of your expended Munitions rounded up are recharged after completing a short rest and all of your Munitions after a long rest.

classFeature.name: Burst Strike
entries: When you make a successful melee weapon attack with a Gunblade, you may expend 1 Munitions charge to pull your weapon's trigger and attempt to launch your enemy backwards. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw against your Gunbreaker Save DC. On a failure they take {@dice 1d10} thunder damage and are knocked back 10ft. from your position. They are not knocked back on a success.
This damage increases to {@dice 2d10} at the 6th level, {@dice 3d10} at the 12th level and {@dice 4d10} at the 18th level.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty, Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Gunner Shot
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you gain a new attack option that you can use with the {@action Attack} action. This special attack is a ranged weapon attack with a range of 60 feet which you may only use while wielding a gunblade. You are proficient with it, and you add your Dexterity modifier to the attack and damage rolls. Its damage is thunder, and its damage die is a {@dice d10}. This damage increases to {@dice 2d10} at the 6th level, {@dice 3d10} at the 12th level and {@dice 4d10} at the 18th level. You expend one Munitions charge when you use this attack option.
When you gain the Extra Attack feature, this special attack can be used for any of the attacks you make as part of the {@action Attack} action.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you select select your Gunbreaker style. The Breaker style focuses on weakening foes with special Munitions, the Lionhart style which focuses on enhancing the damage dealt with the weapon's blows and the Revolver style which focuses on ranged combat.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Archetype.

classFeature.name: Quick Hand
entries: Beginning at the 7th level, you are able to load Munitions to your gunblade as a bonus action. You may load up to 8 Munitions charges to your gunblade.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Diplomatic Enforcer
entries: Beginning at the 9th level, while you are within 10ft. of an ally and visible to the target creature, they double their proficiency bonus when making {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Deception} and {@skill Intimidation} checks.
If a medium or smaller creature is missing hit points, you gain advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks against that creature.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Archetype.

classFeature.name: Blasting Zone
entries: Beginning at the 11th level, when you make a successful melee weapon attack with a gunblade, instead of using your Burst Strike feature, you may expend three Munitions charges to cause an explosion originating from you in the direction of the target. All creatures in the 30ft. cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Gunbreaker Save DC. The creature takes {@dice 3d10} Fire damage on a failure, and half as much on a success. This damage increases to {@dice 4d10} at the 15th level, and {@dice 5d10} at the 20th level. You can only use Blasting Zone once per round.
You can also use your action to use Blasting Zone without making a successful melee weapon attack.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Heart of the Vanguard
entries: Beginning at the 13th level, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill, if you already have this skill you gain expertise in it.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Archetype.

classFeature.name: Heart of Stone
entries: Beginning at the 15th level, when you are attacked by a melee weapon while wielding a gunblade, as a reaction you may expend one Munition to gain a +3 bonus to your AC against the attack roll. You must make this declaration before the attack roll result has been confirmed.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sonic Breaker
entries: Beginning at the 17th level, when you make a successful melee weapon attack with a gunblade, instead of using your Burst Strike feature, you may expend three Munitions charges to cause a massive shockwave originating from you in the direction of the target. All creatures in a 60ft. long, 5ft. wide line must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Gunbreaker Save DC. Creatures take {@dice 4d10} thunder damage on a failure, and half as much on a success. This damage increases to {@dice 5d10} at the 20th level. You can only use Sonic Breaker once per round.
You can also use your action to use Sonic Breaker without making a successful melee weapon attack.

classFeature.name: Blood Fest
entries: Beginning at 18th level, as a bonus action you may recover half your munitions. You may do so once before requiring a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype Feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Archetype.

classFeature.name: Dragoon's Trance
entries: Beginning at the 1st level, you are able to fall into a special trance as a bonus action. Your soul is filled with power from your Dragoon forebears. While under the effects of this trance, your jump height becomes a minimum of 30ft. and your jump distance becomes a minimum of 15ft.

Your trance lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or you may end your trance as a bonus action. Some Dragoon abilities may cause your trance to end early. Once you have entered a trance a number of times shown for your dragoon level in the trances column for your dragoon table you must finish a long rest before you can enter a trance again.

classFeature.name: Jump
entries: Also beginning at the 1st level, as an action you are able to perform a jump attack. Through the power of your Dragoon Trance you leap up to 30ft. into the air and land on a creature within 15ft. of your starting position. The creature makes a Dexterity saving throw against your Dive DC as calculated below, taking your weapon damage and bonus damage equal to {@dice 1d6} on a failure, and half as much on a success. This bonus damage is increased to {@dice 2d6} at the 5th level {@dice 3d6} at the 11th level and {@dice 4d6} at the 18th level.

You may not use Jump on a creature who is higher than 30ft. nor does not have at least 5ft. of space above their head. After finishing your Jump, select an empty space adjacent to the target creature to land on. If the creature's size is Huge or larger, you may choose to attempt to land on the creature instead by making a Dexterity saving throw of a difficulty decided by the DM. You do not take fall damage as a result of using the Jump feature. Movement using the Jump feature does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty, Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Lancet
entries: Also beginning at 2nd level, while under the effects of Dragoon's Trance, as an action you may make a melee weapon attack that drains your target's vitality. You recover hit points equal to half the damage of your weapon attack rounded up. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Strength modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a short rest.

classFeature.name: Dragoon Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you select the focus of your training as a dragoon. Some Dragoon's stick to their roots and fight as Dragon Slayers, while some attempt to harness the power of Dragons and combine it with their unique martial abilities becoming Dragon Hearts. Some Dragoon's decide to break away from their dragon hunting roots and attempt to master the skies as Valkyries.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Heavy Thrust
entries: Beginning at the 5th level, as an action you may make a melee weapon attack which deals its weapon and bonus damage twice. You may reroll the weapon damage of either or both hits but must use the new result. On a critical hit, both damage rolls benefit from the critical hit.

classFeature.name: True Thrust
entries: Also beginning at the 5th level, as an action you may make a melee weapon attack with double the proficiency bonus on the attack roll.

classFeature.name: Stall
entries: Beginning at the 6th level, while under the effects of Dragoon Trance, as a bonus action when you reach the peak of any jump, you may pause in place for a moment. At the end of your next turn you continue your fall, allowing you to perform an action while suspended in the air.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Dragoon Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: High Jump
entries: Beginning at the 9th level, while under the effects of Dragoon Trance, as an action you leap up to 80ft. into the air. At the start of your next turn, you land on a creature within 30ft. of your starting position. The creature makes a Dexterity saving throw against your Dive DC, taking twice your weapon damage and bonus damage equal to {@dice 4d6}.
This bonus damage is increased to {@dice 6d6} at the 11th level and {@dice 8d6} at the 18th level.

You may not use Jump on a creature who is higher than 80ft. nor has at least 5ft. of space above their head. After finishing your Jump, select an empty space adjacent to the target creature to land on. If the creature's size is Huge or larger, you may choose to attempt to land on the creature instead by making a Dexterity saving throw of a difficulty decided by the DM. You do not take fall damage as a result of the High Jump ability. Movement using the High Jump feature does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

classFeature.name: Crash Landing
entries: Beginning at the 10th level, when you complete a successful Spineshatter Dive or High Jump, if the target creature has a flying speed, it is reduced to 0ft. for a number of rounds equal to your Strength modifier.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Dragoon Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Chaos Thrust
entries: Beginning at the 13th level, as an action you make a melee weapon attack. If your attack is successful the creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Dive DC, beginning to bleed on a failure, taking {@dice ld8} piercing damage at the start of their turn. As an action, the creature may reattempt to pass the saving throw to stop the bleeding. A creature will bleed for a number of rounds equal to your Strength modifier.

classFeature.name: Invigorate
entries: Beginning at the 14th level, when you fail a saving throw you may choose to reroll the saving throw. You must use the new number. You can use this feature twice. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Dragoon Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Dragonfire Dive
entries: Beginning at the 17th level, when you use your Jump or High Jump action, you can empower the attack with fiery fury. The bonus damage on the dive is increased to {@dice 8d8} fire damage. All creatures within 20ft. of the target creature take this bonus damage and must make a Dexterity saving throw against the Dive DC, taking the full bonus damage on a failure and half as much on a success. Your Dragoon Trance ends after performing a Dragonfire Dive.

classFeature.name: Battle Litany
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, while you are under the effects of Dragoon's Trance, as a bonus action you can inspire the ferocity of yourself and your allies. Your melee weapon attacks and those of your allies who are within 10ft. of you land critical hits on die results 19 or 20 for a number of rounds equal to half your Strength modifier. This does not overwrite or add to already present critical hit range increases. This effect may be activated once each time you enter a new Dragoon's Trance.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: One with the Sky
entries: Beginning at the 20th level, when you roll initiative, you gain two uses of Dragoon's Trance.

classFeature.name: Well of Darkness
entries: Beginning at the 1st level, you are able to draw on the darkness in your heart and use it as power. You have a number of Well of Darkness points shown for your Dark Knight level in the Well of Darkness Points column of your Dark Knight table. You regain all of your expended uses of your Well of Darkness when you finish a long rest.
Certain features make use of your Well of Darkness and require your target to make a saving throw, the saving throw is calculated as follows.
When using spells which require you to make a ranged spell attack, your spell attack modifier is calculated as follows.

classFeature.name: Darkside
entries: Also beginning at 1st level, as a bonus action you may spend one Well of Darkness point to fill your body with dark power for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma Modifier. When you make a melee weapon attack while under the effect of Darkside, you deal additional necrotic damage as indicated on the Class Table.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty, Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Burning Blood
entries: Also beginning at the 2nd level, as a bonus action you may expend one of your hit die and roll it. You recover Well of Darkness points equal to the result. You cannot exceed your maximum number of Well of Darkness points.

classFeature.name: Dark Knight Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you choose which path of the dark knight to follow. The Blackblood focuses on martial ability, relying on powerful swordplay over magical arts. The Abyss Knight lets the dark powers within themselves flow freely, letting them become more powerful the more dire their situation is, and the Dark Magus uses that inner darkness to cast powerful magical spells alongside their stellar sword skill.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Archetype.

classFeature.name: The Blackest Night
entries: Beginning at the 7th level, as a bonus action you may expend one Hit Die to create a barrier which protects you or a creature within 30ft. of you. Roll the expended hit die, the target gains temporary hit points equal to the die result + your Charisma modifier.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Fight or Flight
entries: Beginning at the 9th level you are able to spend 2 Well of Darkness points to cast the {@spell cause fear|XGE} or {@spell compelled duel} spells.

classFeature.name: Curse of the Abyss
entries: Beginning at the 10th level, on your turn you may use a bonus action to curse a creature. The curse lasts for 1 minute. The curse ends when the creature dies, you die or are {@condition incapacitated}. Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target. The bonus equals your proficiency bonus.
Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.
If the cursed target dies, you regain hit points equal to your Dark Knight level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 hit point) and 1 Well of Darkness point.

entries: You must then finish a long rest to use Curse of the Abyss again.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Abyssal Communion
entries: Beginning at 13th level, you may spend 6 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell Rary's telepathic bond}.

classFeature.name: Quietus
entries: Beginning at the 14th level, you strike with a swirl of dark energy. As an action, you may spend 2 Well of Darkness points to make a melee weapon attack to all creatures within 10ft. of you. You may expend one hit die and roll it to deal additional necrotic damage equal to the result to all creatures attacked.

classFeature.name: Dark Mind
entries: Beginning at the 15th level, you gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Archetype.

classFeature.name: Stalwart Soul
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, your body becomes fueled by your inner darkness. At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier if you have no more than half of your hit points left. You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Living Dead
entries: Beginning at the 20th level when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, instead of becoming {@condition unconscious}, you may expend one hit die and recover hit points equal to the result + your Constitution modifier.

classFeature.name: Dazzling Dance
entries: At 1st level, as you fight you build towards empowering your movements further. When you use the {@action Attack} action against a hostile creature, you gain a charge of Dazzling Dance. You may hold a number of Dazling Dance charges equal to your Charisma modififer. Your charges dissipate one minute after combat ends.
Additionally, you may spend 1 Dazzling Dance charge to take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Flourish
entries: Also beginning at the 1st level, once per turn, you can deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage ot one creature you hit with a ranged weapon attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse weapon.
You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't {@condition incapacitated}, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.
The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Flourish Damage column of the Dancer table.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: By 2nd level, you have learned to draw on in latent magical energies around you into your bangles and use it to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the PHB for the general rules of spellcasting and end of this document for the {@filter Dancer spell list|spells|class=Dancer (FFXIVBeforetheFall5E)}.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Dancer table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your Dancer spells. to cast one of your dancer spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of Dancer spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the Dancer spell list. When you do so, choose a number of Dancer spells equal to your Charisma modifier + half your Dancer level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 5th-level Dancer, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Charisma of 14, your list of prepared spells can include four spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of Dancer spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: At least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Dance Magic
entries: As a Dancer, when you cast a Dancer spell you do not have to fulfill the verbal component of the spell. You must spend 10ft. of movement alongside your spell slot to cast a spell or to maintain a spell.

entries.name: What about Silence?
entries: Most spellcasters shudder at the thought of being silenced as their spells require a verbal component nearly every time. As a Dancer you are able to for go the verbal component, but that does not mean you're free from having your spells blocked. Instead, any effects which would drop your movement speed to 0ft. will instead cause your spells to be blocked.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Dancer spells, since their power derives from the strength of your convictions. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Dancer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use bangles, anklets or other jewelry inlaid with gem stones (see the {@book Adventuring Gear|PHB|5} section) as a spellcasting focus for your Dancer Spells.

classFeature.name: Whirling Steel
entries: Also at 2nd level, you can spend 1 hour attuning your recently discovered magics with up to two finesse throwing weapons. When you throw a weapon you are attuned with, it returns to your hand after the attack is resolved.

classFeature.name: Dancer Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a style which dictates your growth as a dancer. The Paragon focuses on mastering and pushing the limits of dance as an art. The Exotic Wonder mixes bladework into their dance moves, mixing martial prowess with grace. The Peace Bringer seeks to bring succor and support to their allies in the heat of battle.
